column2: A public class or interface that does not have a Javadoc comment affects maintainability.
column4: This type does not have a non-trivial Javadoc comment.

column2: A field of immutable type that is assigned to only in a constructor or static initializer of its declaring type, but is not declared 'final', may lead to defects and makes code less readable.
column4: This immutable field is not declared final but is only assigned to during initialization.
